name: Moevenpick Hotel Amsterdam City Center

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the Moevenpick over a weekend, Fri-Mon, at the end of August '07.
reviews.title: Clean and classy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: To be honest it's a step up in class from the hotel I would normally stay at, mainly due to us getting a fantastic '3 nights for 2' deal via Expedia for booking 'early', though I only booked about 4 weeks in advance.
reviews.title: Enjoyed our stay

reviews.text: The hotel itself I believe is fairly new, opened in Nov 2006 (?), so it's all very clean and fresh looking. The staff who greeted us at the front desk were polite, helpful and spoke very good English.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room itself was spacious, clean and comfortable. Although we had booked a room with a King-size bed we were informed when we booked in that this was now unavailable and 2 twin beds were all they could offer. Although the bathroom was clean and the shower worked well there was no lock on the glass (!) bathroom door, which I think is taking the traditional Dutch relaxed feel a little too far.
reviews.title: Amazing views of the city and sunset

reviews.text: That said we had no real complaints about the standard of the hotel, and despite being situated next to a busy port and what appeared to be a main road there was no noise at night.
reviews.title: Great hotel, will stay there again

reviews.text: Due some unforeseen changes in our travel plans, we needed a hotel in Amsterdam for a couple of nights right away. We had never heard of Movenpick but it was the cheapest on the list that didn't look like a dive. So we took a chance and booked it. It turned out to be a very upscale business hotel with plenty of amenities, very well appointed rooms and excellent service all around. My only complaint would be the breakfast buffet, which is bad to say the least and expensive at €23 and should be skipped. The hotel is also about a 25 minute walk from Centraal Station, but there is also a tram station not too far.
reviews.title: Movenpick and Amsterbike - A pleasant surprise

likes.disliked: — a bt far from city center

reviews.text: Another pleasant surprise was Amsterbike, a bike rental place in the garage right under the hotel. The rates were very reasonable (€20 for two days) and I got a nice new bike that looked like a regular Amsterdam bike, not like the usual tourist rental bike. The owner was very friendly and suggested a couple of tours.
reviews.title: Excellent all round hotel

likes.disliked: — Out of town- but good value as a result

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although not located in the centre of Amsterdam, the hotel is easy to access by tram, 1/2 hourly free shuttle bus, taxi or on foot. It is only a single tram stop or EURO 7 taxi ride to Centraal.
reviews.title: Great hotel in slightly inconvenient location

likes.disliked: — location and some of the staff

reviews.text: The out of town location means you get a lot more for your money- we paid about £110 per night which is excellent value for the facilities. We didn't have breakfast but chose to head into town. The concierge recommended an excellent place for breakfast just off Dam square.
reviews.title: Loved Moevenpick and Amsterbike

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The reception and bar staff are very helpful, polite and attentive. The rooms are spacious and well decorated. The bar and reception area are also well decorated, attractive spaces.
reviews.title: Great View - Scalding Hot Water

likes.disliked: — Price and Scalding Water in Shower

reviews.title: Awesome Hotel, Fab Service, Upgraded Room A++++
reviews.text: Fantastic new hotel 10 mins walk from Central Station. As some reviewers have pointed out, it is a fair way from town but is only around 10 euros in a taxi to dam square, central station etc. got it for a fantastic rate of 100GBP per night plus city tax so a good deal. arrived at 10am left luggage no problem. returned at 1pm (an hour earlier than advertised check in) and recived an upgraded room (junior suite) as no standard doubles were available. Room was immaculate and obviously less than two months old. shower hot and powerful, aircon didnt seem to work meaning it was rather hot but not a huge problem. checked out over an hour late, no doggy looks or snide comments. First class throughout. A note to the bad reviewers... no-one claimed it was right in the centre and its a brand new contemporary style hotel, not a 90's marriott with floral curtains and bed covers.
After reading the positive reviews on tripadvisor, I was really looking forward to my short one-night stay at Movenpick but came away disappointed.
reviews.title: Highs and lows

reviews.text: The location wasn't a problem but realistically it is a 15 minute walk rather than 10 from the station and if you're dragging a suitcase, you might want to reconsider the healthy option. The check in process was friendly and efficient. My booking request for a high floor had been noted and I was given a room on the 16th floor. No cruise ship in dock that night unfortunately but really amazing views. The room was absolutely top notch, just beautiful. Really nicely designed, spotlessly clean and very comfortable. The bathroom was equally impressive apart from the strange lack of washcloths and an extractor fan that whistled constantly like a haunted house.
reviews.title: Plenty of problems, especially with service

reviews.text: I used the (very welcome) free wi-fi and it seemed to work fine. I slept well and woke up to a beautiful sunrise over the river. So far, pretty good but now for the bad part. Breakfast was included in my room rate and what happened in the restaurant totally soured the entire experience. Without doubt it was the worst service I've ever had in a 4 star hotel.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel. Super impressed---Outskirts of City Centre

likes.disliked: — Isloated from rest of City Centre, Tram knowledge is a must.

reviews.text: I arrived at 0930 and it was not busy but seemed very disorganised. The range of food and quality couldn't be faulted. The tables were not laid properly so I had to ask for cutlery. I'd been been sat and eating for 10 minutes but not one of the three waiting staff had offered me coffee. Again I had to ask. I had to ask again for a refill (have NEVER had that in any hotel, the waiters are usually falling over themselves to top your cup up). All the time I was there, I didn't see any of the waiters instigate any communication with the diners. Everything had to be asked for.
reviews.title: Loved Movenpick

likes.liked: — Great view, comfortable bed and clean bathroom
likes.disliked: — Wi-fi in the hotel not working very well. It cut off while email to be sent.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: But this is the strangest thing - 20 mins before the end of breakfast service, there was a sudden flurry of activity and the staff started to lay all the tables! They must have laid for about 40 covers when there was only maybe 5 people that came through the door in that time. Unfortunately they didn't even do it properly so a man opposite sat down and had a coffee mug and placemat but had to awkwardly ask for some cutlery. It really was an amazing shambles.
reviews.title: Loved the moevenpick

reviews.text: Our stay at Movenpick was very comfortable. To begin with the concierge was responsive and accomodative of our request for a pick up and guided us well on where we can expect him and what to look out for. The reception staff too was very helpful with supporting enquiries. The room service staff were the best, they were like the quiet and super efficient, rooms clean, all utilities made available and the best part was since we were travelling with a child we had opted for 2 twin beds however to our lovely surprise when we returned in the evening our sofa which could also be used as a bed was nicely done up with extra bedding and pillow and all. The views of the pier and the boats and ships was very serene and we had a lovely time. Would love to return back someday to enjoy the city more..
reviews.title: Excellent stay

reviews.text: Although the hotel is not located right in the center of the city but everything is accessible within walking distance of 10 minutes and there is public transportation right in front of the hotel, the hotel staff was very polite, happy to help and give information.
reviews.title: Amazing !!!

reviews.text: The hotel's breakfast is very luxurious and filling, just lick your fingers!
reviews.title: nice stay

reviews.text: This was a fab place and we booked this through Lastminute.com as a secret hotel. We went to see the tulips in Keukenhof garden and just loved everything. The hotel has wonderful views overlooking the water. Every evening we got to see the sunset and the city lights from the 18th floor. And it was fantastic! But just as another guest has written the toilet could do with another bit of cleaning. The rest was all fine.
reviews.title: AMAZING

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beautiful view from the room...prompt and courteous staff...a little expensive but worth the money..the check in time was a little late and we didnt get rooms till 3 in the afternoon but the staff guided us perfectly on taking a tour of the city and we had the perfect day !!!
reviews.title: Lovely hotel and amazing breakfast!

reviews.text: Stayed at the Movenpick for a three night stay and was a little apprehensive as it is only recently opened and primarily attracts business travellers whilst we were away for a girls weekend. From the time we checked in to the time we left, the service was first class and I would find it very difficult to fault anything. My last stay in Amsterdam was at a hotel in Dam square which was really central so I found this slightly more awkward to get to and from but they state it's 10 minutes from Central Station to walk so that was exactly as advertised.
reviews.title: Really super hotel
Surprisingly Impressed by the Movenpick Amsterdam
reviews.text: Rooms were super, a lot of money invested in both desinging and furnishing the hotel. Beds were extremely comfortable, beautiful bathroom and we were lucky to have a superb view over the canal which was like nothing you could ever imagine once it got dark at night. Amazing.

Breakfast fab, bar very cosy but the one thing above everything was the service. Staff couldn't do enough to help throughout our stay and didn't treat us .any differently when we left the hotel in our jeans for a days shopping whilst the Armani suit guys left for business which is a nice thing to say.
reviews.title: Very nice place, certain drawbacks

likes.liked: — getting to choose between different types of pillows and the complimentary non-alcoholic fruit drinks
likes.disliked: — distance from city centre (not terrible though, just annoying)

reviews.text: Highly recommend it but if you don't like walking the 10 mins. to Dam square you should stay somehwere more central but it won't be anything like the Movenpick!
reviews.title: Bring supplies

likes.disliked: — Spartan, cold, no vending machines, far from downtown

reviews.text: Having read recent reviews from other guests here, I was a little anxious about my stay. However, thus far (1 night into my 3 night stay) I am really rather impressed.
reviews.title: Er... what can I say?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just came back from amsterdam
reviews.title: Recommended !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed there with my wife for 6 nights
reviews.title: Movenpick Hotel Amsterdam NOT IN THE City Center

reviews.text: The hotel is new !
reviews.title: Nice hotel, shame about the location

reviews.text: Very nice rooms - big, new and has everyithing.
reviews.title: Pleasant but far from centre

reviews.text: We stayed at the 19th floor - the view is amazing !
reviews.title: New, neat, stark, a small hike

likes.liked: — Free wireless internet, reasonable phones, view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for 3 nights room very comfortable huge bed very clean it was a pleasure to stay there and I would definately stay again.
reviews.title: Fantastic a little difficult for access

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However the walk into town centre is 10 to 15mins not too bad but its a little awkward to get to the entrance of the hotel it looks very easy on approach but you have to go all the way to the bottom of an arching road and then cut accross to the passenger terminal to get to it not really a major prob but could be a bit of a b@@er after a long day walk when feet are tired. If your young and or fit then no probs if you want to have easy access and want to be in city centre then dont bother.
reviews.title: Over-rated hotel

reviews.text: I would reccomend it was fab!!!!
reviews.title: would not go back or suggest it to anyone

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: PS breakfast was a shock it was not included but me and my fella decided to try it one morning it worked out costing 42euros!!!!! very expensive
reviews.title: Loved Movenpick

reviews.text: I totally agree with the previous review. This hotel has lots of issues. We stayed from the 27th January for three nights. The hotel is about a 5 min drive from the train station (take a train from Schiphol not a taxi as it is only 4 euros each and the trains leave from the airport every 15 mins). The hotel is 20 mins from the centre, the walk is fine and that was not a problem.
reviews.title: Great place to stay!

likes.liked: — The "newness" and style of the hotel
likes.disliked: — the distance to the city....which was still not bad, only a 15 minute walk.

reviews.text: This hotel is very new. The rooms are very nice and comfortable.
reviews.title: New Hotel With A Few Problems

reviews.text: A good breakfast buffet is served for 15 Euros. The hotel staff needs a little more training. I think because the hotel is so new various problems need to be addressed. The rooms were very warm and the cooling system did not cool the rooms. Upon opening the windows, the sound of the trains is constant because of the proximity to Central Station. On our third night at the hotel, a band was playing outside so loudly that we were not able to sleep until after 1 AM. After calling the front desk in the afternoon to have my room cleaned, the room was never cleaned. The staff did bring clean linens after I complained to the front desk.
reviews.title: Excellent, Modern, Great Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a great time in the Netherlands, and a good part of the credit goes to this wonderful hotel, the Movenpick. We stayed there for four nights. They were kind enough to help us out by finding a room for us on Queen's Day!!!!
reviews.title: The Movenpick in Amsterdam

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is clean, the employees very nice. The food in their restaurant is expensive, however there is a nice place on the dock a few meters toward Amsterdam with good food and reasonable prices.
reviews.title: Not bad

reviews.text: stayed here with my wife and 14 year old son. was a bit concerned about the position of the hotel and the attitude of it's staff. Firstly may I say that walking to the hotel from Central station took us 8-10 minutes, and thats was after a few beers at manchester airport!! The walk is safe but because there are not many people around you may feel a little starnge. I have been to Amsterdam many many times and it is by far and away the safest city I have EVER Been to. Secondly the hotel staff were very polite and helpful (as most Dutch people are!)
reviews.title: excellent hotel, ignore the bad comments!!!!!

likes.liked: — the whole quality feel of the place
likes.disliked: — maybe a little pricey for food/drinks but not too much.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is excellent in all departments, the rooms are well equppped and a lot roomier than other hotels in the "centre" prices in the bar/restarant were a little high , but this is a five star hotel in one of the top 10 most expensive places in Europe!!!
reviews.title: Great hotel, just a bit off city centre...

reviews.text: Now for the basics.
reviews.title: Worthwhile Hotel

reviews.text: The tram number 25/26 stops right outside the hotel across the road and services the town (dam square and central station) until 1am. The hotel shuttle bus now runs till 100pm and there have upgraded the bus to a seven seater VW, Just book with the door man.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel

reviews.text: If you have been to the Dam before you will know exactly where the red light district/coffee shops are. But there is so so much more to amsterdam than these two. My advice is get a (free) map from the hotel and explore, you will get lost there is no-doubting that!! but will discover small areas where you would not think you were in a city that has all the excess a man can handle.
reviews.title: Not In The City Center!!!!

reviews.text: The Moevenpick is a beautiful hotel with great amenities. The rooms are spacious and very nice with beautiful bathrooms. The hotel is very clean and modern with very helpful staff.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Location is Okay

reviews.text: The one issue I had with the Movenpick was the location. While it was beautiful being on the water and having great views from our 11th floor room, the hotel is a bit out of the way. It is about a 10 minute walk to the central train station, but it takes around 30 minutes to walk to any major sights other than the red light district.
reviews.title: Excellently located with a few gliches

reviews.text: I would probably stay here again since the hotel is so comfortable and beautiful, but the location was definitely a bit of a downside for me since I enjoy being in the center of things.
reviews.title: I recomend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed in this hotel for a week-end got it as a mystery hotel with easy-to-book at a special rate. Had a room on the 9th floor which gives you a spectacular view of amsterdam. The draw back is mainly in getting by foot to central station and city centre is rather like going thro' a building site. I enquired at book in how much was the breakfast and was quoted a very step €23 now i discovered the following morning that the bar was serving breakfast for far less this was never pointed out to me, The other concern i would have is that there were signs of mildew in the shower cubical which would indicate that the hotel is lacking in cleanliness that one would expect from a hotel of this standard.Also the kettle in room was faulty and showed no indication of when it was serviced.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel in a great location

reviews.text: Good hotel, good shape.Great view from upper floors. Stuff at the reception could be better, concierge desk very good and helpful.
reviews.title: Great view, great room, great food, great location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 4 nights at the Moevenpick Hotel in Amsterdam. The hotel is modern, big for Amsterdam standards, and despite the location (not in the city center as the name suggests), very convenient. It is a 15-minute walk from Central Station, and a couple of minutes with the free shuttle bus, but I would definitely suggest renting a bicycle from the parking lot right in front of the hotel. Renting a bike on the 2nd day of our stay, and not towards the end, was a very good decision!!
reviews.title: Good hotel, although a bit expensive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have two negative comments about the hotel, and both are regarding room service. On 1 occasion, the tea cup and an empty bottle left the night before were not discarded, and in the case of the tea, not replaced. On another occasion, we left dirty towels on the floor of the bathroom when we left in the morning, and found them folded again when we came back in the evening. From previous experience I understood that leaving dirty towels on the floor is a request for clean ones? It was surely my expectation, which was not met. I don't think this is acceptable for the price of this hotel.
reviews.title: Falling short of 4 star status on service and cleanliness...

reviews.text: Everything else was very good (including free internet), so overall, I would recomment this hotel. I didn't have breakfast, so I can't comment on that.
reviews.title: GREAT HOTEL

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel with my girlfriend over the Easter weekend. We arrived late on Thursday night as our flight was delayed and walked from Centraal station. This is not a great idea, whilst it is only a 15 minute walk, with bags and with several of the roads under construction and with an entrance that appears much nearer than it is (you have to walk 400 metres-ish round instead of taking a direct bridge as there is for the neighbouring concert hall).
reviews.title: Fabulous hotel with amazing views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we checked in the service was rushed and un-friendly (an older gentleman with shaved head and glasses), and actually unhelpful when asking about ways to get about. We got to our room to find it was a twin-room, not a double as specifically requested but by this time we were so shattered that we just wanted to sleep. The inside of the toilet was absolutely disgusting, brown almost all over, as if they hadn't been cleaned in weeks or months. More fitting of a scene from trainspotting than a supposed 4 star hotel?!
reviews.title: An excellent hotel

reviews.text: We had looked forward to stay there,when we arrived there was nobody to offer any help with our bags as porters seemed uninterested.Receptionist was very kind.After we were checked in,we picked up our luggage and went towards lifts and again no reaction from porters who were looking on internet.Room was nice,good quality furnishings,comfortable beds.TV had no music channels like Viva or MTV available,strange but no big deal.
reviews.title: Far from Moevenpick Standards

reviews.text: Internet also kept dragging and disconecting from time to time,when we called reception we were informed that there is a problem and that`s all they knew.Breakfast was good but then we noticed that following days some items were not available,and people who clear tables try to get you out of there as soon as possible.Have stayed in Movenpicks before but this one lacks the standards and passion that the rest of Movenpick hotels has.Seems like staff there has no motivation or interest I am not talking about everybody but the ones we noticed.
reviews.title: Great Value

reviews.text: This hotel was a great find for a quick weekend trip to Amsterdam. The hotel is not directly in downtown Amsterdam but is only a few short blocks away from the train station and anything else you might like to do. The room was immaculate and decently sized compared to most European hotel rooms. All in all it was a great experience at the Movenpick.
reviews.title: Great hotel & location!
Good looks, No bath, and Long Walk!
reviews.text: hi

While the Movenpick is not in the center of town, (we were somewhat happy about that, especially around Queens' Day) it is very accessible via the Tram # 26, ( runs very frequently, takes about six minutes to get there from Station Centraal). Read Rick Steves. When you arrive buy at least the part of the IAmsterdam pass that gets you on the buses and trams...best deal in the world. We bought a three day pass, but you can customize that to your plans.
reviews.title: nice view of the river but several blocks outside of main city and station

likes.disliked: — not in the middle of the night life and overpriced

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Dutch were very helpful, friendly, and really organized when it came to managing what we were exposed to. A majority of the Dutch speak English. Downside...look out for pickpockets in the crowds. Use a money belt. We took public transportation to De Hoge Veluwe, a national park, a wonderful place, google it....and to the Keukenhof, highlights of our trip.
reviews.title: Not City and surely not City center

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Got a great deal (less than US$100) using Priceline on the Movenpick for three nights.
reviews.title: Great View!
Nice room, Great service, location so-so
reviews.text: Large rooms for Amsterdam, with views over the waterfront behind the Amsterdam Station. The sofa-bed is comfortable for an extra adult or kid. Free shuttle ever 30 mins to and from the Amsterdam Station, which is otherwise a 10-15 min walk away along the waterfront. It was raining a bit during our stay, so we made good use of the shuttle. Breakfast is very good, but dinner was so-so, suggest you try other places to eat in Amsterdam. Service is very good, concierge and shuttle drivers very friendly and helpful.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall a very good place, mainly chose this hotel as it had big rooms which could accomodate 3 people comfortably, but will stay in a more central and older part of town next time.
reviews.title: Great Service

reviews.text: Free internet also a big plus.
reviews.title: Great location, good service but let down by the food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I read reviews that it was isolated from city centre, but you have excellent tram connections (2 mins from Hotel) Hop on canal boat was also 2 mins from hotel. The walk into centre of Amsterdam was 15 - 20 mins and that was at a leisurely pace taking in the sights and sounds of beautiful Amsterdam. All the staff at hotel were great. Breakfast was also very good. We had a meal in main restuarant and againwas excellent but a little pricey. Would return
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel with amazingly comfortable beds!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The service offered to get to the hotel was excellent. Calling the concierge from the train at Schipol Airport meant that there was a hotel shuttle bus waiting at Amsterdam Centraal when the train arrived there. The transer was very quick, around five minutes. (Equally it is only a short walk from the station).This made getting to the hotel from the airport both exceptionally easy and low cost. If only other hotels offered such a useful service.
reviews.title: Great luxury hotel, 10 minute walk from town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 3 nights at the Movenpick Amsterdam hotel in mid-October. Previous reviews of this hotel are spot on.
reviews.title: Great Hotel and Staff

likes.disliked: — Towels, shower wall, no mattress pads

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you arrive at Central Station and plan to walk to the hotel, exit out the back (towards the water), cross the road and turn right. You will see the hotel as you take a leisurely (10-15 minute) walk along the water. If you plan on taking the 25 tram, exit the front of the station and turn left. Tram 25 departs from the end of the station. We found it easier to disembark the tram at the second stop (going past the hotel) as you did not need to cross the road or walk the ramp. Also, the hotel runs a shuttle service to the station every thirty minutes (hour and half hour) dropping off at the loading area at the back of the station. This is by request and it does not operate if no one is coming from the hotel, but we were able to catch a ride back to the hotel by waiting for the shuttle one day. Definitely use the shuttle to the station as an alternative to walking or the tram. Tram tickets are good for two hours.
reviews.title: Loved this hotel

likes.liked: — Fabulous beds, pillow menu and the smoked salmon at breakfast!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff at this hotel is superb. Very friendly, willing to assist with any questions and there is an adequate number of people in the lobby. We arrived early (8:00am) and knew our room was not ready. The cordial desk clerk gave us keys to the fitness center so we could shower, change clothes and then check our luggage prior to heading into the city.

reviews.text: Stopped back after 3:00 pm and our room was ready for us on the 17th floor.
reviews.title: Modern, Comfortable Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room overlooked the city and harbor. Marvelous view with boats coming and going, cruise ships docking and the lights of the city. We enjoyed a bottle of wine, great Dutch cheese and crackers in the room each evening just to take in the view. As others have mentioned, the rooms are basic but comfortable. In room safe, refrig, tea and coffee packets provided. Nice size modern bathroom with tub/shower. I still am trying to figure out the crazy half glass shower wall as each time I used the shower the bathroom floor ended up wet. Could use an upgrade on the locker room quality towels.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel - slightly off pitch for a city break

likes.liked: — Modern and large room with great view

reviews.text: 1) bathrooms doors are glass and relatively see through, nice privacy for others in your room

reviews.text: 2) No vending machines, store, water, ANYTHING. Good luck if you get thirsty.
reviews.title: Newly opened, a lot to improve

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 3) It is 10-15 minutes walk to get to everything - not terrible - but reality
reviews.title: Must stay again!

likes.disliked: — frosted glass door to bathroom and no lock on bathroom door. bathroom was private but didnt feel it/.

reviews.text: That's right folks, there is a non-smoking hotels among all the madness that is Amsterdam. The one year old Moevenpick (Swiss parent company) Hotel is a beautiful property that sits on the water in Amsterdam. Staff is very friendly, courteous and customer focused despite the fact that it's one of the largest hotels in the city. Nice bar downstairs that also serves food until 11pm and the beds are among the most comfortable I've ever slept in. Location is about a 10 minute walk from Central Station and 20-25 minute from the infamous Red Light District. They will provide a free shuttle on the hour to and from the Central Station but not the airport. You can take a shuttle for 12.50 euros and taxi to airport would be approximately 45-50 euros. Was upgraded to a suite (Europeans have a different definition of suites than Americans, it was a large room) and it was immaculate. Can't miss by staying here.
reviews.title: Non-smoking, yes, non-smoking hotel in Amsterdam

likes.disliked: — Couldn't get an early check in.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This new hotel is really a good choice. We had a very quiet room on a high floor, it was tastefully decorated, and came with a luxurious bathroom, comfy beds, great view looking out over the harbour. The hotel is within walking distance of the central train station and the city center. After some Internet deal hunting, we finally got the best deal by contacting the hotel directly. The buffet breakfast was extravagant! There is also a nice trendy bar. Overall, it was a very pleasant stay.
reviews.title: Very comfortable, trendy and friendly, convenient location

reviews.text: I stayed at the Movenpick over a weekend recently. Like others I found the hotel to be exceptionally clean and modern, with great views over the water and city. It is entirely non-smoking, even the bar and restaurant, something I don't take for granted in Amsterdam.
reviews.title: Exceptional hotel, exceptional value

likes.disliked: — construction in front of the hotel at present makes it difficult to access on foot

description: Welcome to the Mövenpick Hotel Amsterdam City Center. With a prime location in the city of Amsterdam, this elegant hotel is the ideal venue for your executive travel, meeting and conferences or private ventures in matters of art and culture.
